poem:
### Father of the Bride Revisited

Newsprint coffee rings blur the paternalistic,  
as she spins in a kitchen chair—  
his eyes, a lens of two eras.  
A daughter—Rome still on her laughter—  
becomes a twirling child again.  
Passports and promises fold into  
a kaleidoscope world, where the heart  
clutches its worry, even in delight.
